data.name: Bellsprout
data.flavorText: Its bud looks like a human face. Because of the bud, it is rumored to be a type of legendary mandrake plant.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Victreebel
data.flavorText: Once ingested into this Pokémon's body, even the hardest object will melt into nothing.

abilities.name: Fragrance Trap
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Corrosive Acid
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Weepinbell
data.flavorText: It spits out Poison Powder to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of Acid.

attacks.name: Growth
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Grass Energy cards from your hand to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double Razor Leaf
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.name: Spinarak
data.flavorText: Some fishermen weave its sturdy thread into nets to catch fish Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stun Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

data.name: Scyther
data.flavorText: While young, they live together deep in the mountains, training themselves in how to fight with their scythes and move at high speeds.

attacks.name: Twin Play
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Scyther and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Ariados
data.flavorText: It spins thread from both its rear and its mouth. Then it wraps its prey up in thread and sips their bodily fluids at its leisure.

attacks.name: Reactive Poison
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Special Condition affecting your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spider Trap
attacks.text: You may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

data.name: Treecko
data.flavorText: Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on walls and ceilings. That is how it can hang from above.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

data.name: Treecko
data.flavorText: Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on walls and ceilings. That is how it can hang from above.

data.name: Grovyle
data.flavorText: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Sceptile
data.flavorText: It agilely leaps about the jungle and uses the sharp leaves on its arms to strike its prey.

abilities.name: Power of Nature
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Pokémon that have any Grass Energy attached to them by attacks from your opponent's Ultra Beasts.

attacks.name: Powerful Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Sceptile
data.flavorText: It agilely leaps about the jungle and uses the sharp leaves on its arms to strike its prey.

abilities.name: Power of Nature
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Pokémon that have any Grass Energy attached to them by attacks from your opponent's Ultra Beasts.

attacks.name: Powerful Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Seedot
data.flavorText: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks if that damage is 40 or less.

data.name: Seedot
data.flavorText: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.

data.name: Shiftry-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Den of Iniquity-GX
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Your opponent shuffles that Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Nuzleaf
data.flavorText: It lives deep in forests. With the leaf on its head, it makes a flute whose song makes listeners uneasy.

attacks.name: Clear the Room
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Choose a Supporter card you find there. Your opponent shuffles that card into their deck.

data.name: Masquerain
data.flavorText: Its wings and antennae don't cope well with moisture. After a rain, it faces sunward to dry off.

attacks.name: Surprising Pattern
attacks.text: Discard all Special Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hurricane Wing
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.name: Surskit
data.flavorText: When this Pokémon senses danger, a sweet fluid oozes from the tip of its head. The taste of it disgusts bird Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Volbeat
data.flavorText: It lives around clean ponds. At night, its rear lights up. It converses with others by flashing its light.

attacks.name: Pheromone Catch
attacks.text: If your Illumise used Pheromone Signals during your last turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Illumise
data.flavorText: With its sweet aroma, it guides Volbeat to draw signs with light in the night sky.

attacks.name: Pheromone Signals
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Cacnea
data.flavorText: It prefers harsh environments such as deserts. It can survive for 30 days on water stored in its body.

abilities.name: Poison Payback
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Tropius
data.flavorText: The bunch of fruit around its neck ripens twice a year and is delicious. It's a highly favored tropical snack.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Dhelmise
data.flavorText: The soul of seaweed adrift in the waves became reborn as this Pokémon. It maintains itself with new infusions of seabed detritus and seaweed.

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Powerful Spin
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Cacturne
data.flavorText: Packs of them follow travelers through the desert until the travelers can no longer move.

abilities.name: Poison Payback
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.name: Slugma
data.flavorText: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn't keep moving, its body will cool and harden.

attacks.name: Magma Ring
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Torchic
data.flavorText: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Torchic
data.flavorText: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Magcargo
data.flavorText: Its body is as hot as lava and is always billowing. Flames will occasionally burst from its shell.

abilities.name: Smooth Over
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a card, shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of it.

data.name: Combusken
data.flavorText: During a battle, the hot flame in its body increases. Its kicks have outstanding destructive power.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Oricorio
data.flavorText: This Oricorio has sipped red nectar. Its passionate dance moves cause its enemies to combust in both body and mind.

attacks.name: Captivating Salsa
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

data.name: Articuno-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Legendary Ascent
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon. If you do, move any number of Water Energy from your other Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cold Crush-GX
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from both Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Blaziken-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Explosive Kick
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blaze Out-GX
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Torkoal
data.flavorText: If the fire burning within its shell goes out, it will die. Those who wish to raise one in their home must always keep something flammable at hand.

attacks.name: Flaming Honk
attacks.text: Discard the top 4 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Fire Energy cards, attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Mudkip
data.flavorText: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.

attacks.name: Water Reserve
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Water Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Mudkip
data.flavorText: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.

data.name: Marshtomp
data.flavorText: Living on muddy ground that provides poor footing has made its legs sturdy.

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Swampert
data.flavorText: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.

abilities.name: Power Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Lotad
data.flavorText: It searches about for clean water. If it does not drink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.name: Lombre
data.flavorText: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.

abilities.name: Aqua Lift
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Wailmer
data.flavorText: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.

attacks.name: Wave Swallower
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, heal 50 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Ludicolo
data.flavorText: The rhythm of bright, festive music activates Ludicolo's cells, making it more powerful.

abilities.name: Swing Dance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card.

attacks.name: Circular Steps
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each other Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's).

data.name: Clamperl
data.flavorText: It is protected by a sturdy shell. Once in a lifetime, it makes a magnificent pearl.

abilities.name: Evolutionary Advantage
abilities.text: If you go second, this Pokémon can evolve during your first turn.

data.name: Wailord
data.flavorText: Its immense size is the reason for its popularity. Wailord watching is a favorite sightseeing activity in various parts of the world.

attacks.name: Dwindling Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 40 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Gorebyss
data.flavorText: Its swimming form is exquisitely elegant. With its thin mouth, it feeds on seaweed that grows between rocks.

attacks.name: Deflecting Splash
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Evolution Pokémon.

data.name: Luvdisc
data.flavorText: Loving couples have a soft spot for this Pokémon, so honeymoon hotels often release this Pokémon into their pools.

attacks.name: Even Game
attacks.text: Search your deck for a number of Basic Pokémon up to the number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and put those Pokémon onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Huntail
data.flavorText: It lives deep in the sea. With a tail shaped like a small fish, it attracts unsuspecting prey.

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Dangerous Bite
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Kyogre
data.flavorText: It is said to have widened the seas by causing downpours. It had been asleep in a marine trench.

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Grand Wave
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Grand Wave during your next turn.

data.name: Regice
data.flavorText: Its body is made of ice from the ice age. It controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.

abilities.name: Icy Barrier
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Stadium cards from their hand.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Voltorb
data.flavorText: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

abilities.name: Floating Electrons
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Chinchou
data.flavorText: It lives in the depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Electrode-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Extra Energy Bomb
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach 5 Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon, except Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, in any way you like. If you do, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Crush and Burn-GX
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Manectric
data.flavorText: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.

abilities.name: Electric Start
abilities.text: If you go second, and if this Pokémon is in your hand when you are setting up to play, you may put it face down as your Active Pokémon or on your Bench.

attacks.name: Double Charge
attacks.text: You may attach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Mr. Mime-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Magic Evens
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by your opponent's attacks if that damage is exactly 20, 40, 60, 80, 100, 120, 140, 160, 180, 200, 220, 240, or 260.

attacks.name: Breakdown
attacks.text: For each card in your opponent's hand, put 1 damage counter on their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Life Trick-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Oricorio
data.flavorText: It creates an electric charge by rubbing its feathers together. It dances over to its enemies and delivers shocking electrical punches.

attacks.name: Zappy Pom-Poms
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Lanturn
data.flavorText: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.

abilities.name: Energy Grounding
abilities.text: When 1 of your Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move a basic Energy card from that Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Electrike
data.flavorText: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.

data.name: Plusle
data.flavorText: It absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out its body to create crackling noises.

attacks.name: Draw for Everybody
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a card for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

data.name: Minun
data.flavorText: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

attacks.name: Ditch and Draw
attacks.text: You may discard any number of cards from your hand. Then, draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

data.name: Gulpin
data.flavorText: There is nothing its stomach can't digest. While it is digesting, vile, overpowering gases are expelled.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Grumpig
data.flavorText: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does an odd dance to gain control over foes.

attacks.name: Mirror Step
attacks.text: If 1 of your opponent's Pokémon in play has the same name as 1 of your Pokémon in play, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Swalot
data.flavorText: It gulps anything that fits in its mouth. Its special enzymes can dissolve anything.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: If, before doing damage, your opponent's Active Pokémon has less remaining HP than this Pokémon, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Spoink
data.flavorText: It bounces around on its tail to keep its heart pumping. It carries a pearl from Clamperl on its head.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Lunatone
data.flavorText: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.

abilities.name: Sol Shade
abilities.text: If you have Solrock in play, Fire Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities, except Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Solrock
data.flavorText: It absorbs solar energy during the day. Always expressionless, it can sense what its foe is thinking.

abilities.name: Sunbeam
abilities.text: The maximum HP of each of your Lunatone in play is 130.

attacks.name: Scorching Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Shuppet
data.flavorText: It loves vengeful emotions and hangs in rows under the eaves of houses where vengeful people live.

data.name: Shuppet
data.flavorText: It loves vengeful emotions and hangs in rows under the eaves of houses where vengeful people live.

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Banette-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shady Move
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 Pokémon to another Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Chant
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Supporter card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 100 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Tomb Hunt-GX
attacks.text: Put 3 cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Banette
data.flavorText: Strong feelings of hatred turned a puppet into a Pokémon. If it opens its mouth, its cursed energy escapes.

abilities.name: Red Eyes
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put a Basic Pokémon from your opponent's discard pile onto their Bench.

attacks.name: Enemy Show
attacks.text: For each of your opponent's Pokémon in play, put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Deoxys
data.flavorText: DNA from a space virus mutated and became a Pokémon. It appears where auroras are seen.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Power Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Deoxys
data.flavorText: DNA from a space virus mutated and became a Pokémon. It appears where auroras are seen.

attacks.name: Reflect
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 40 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Psychic Corkscrew
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Deoxys
data.flavorText: DNA from a space virus mutated and became a Pokémon. It appears where auroras are seen.

attacks.name: Teleportation Burst
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spear Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Lunala
data.flavorText: It is said to be a female evolution of Cosmog. When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.

abilities.name: Shadow Shield
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Psychic Energy attached to it, it takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Full Moon Ray
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Phanpy
data.flavorText: It is strong despite its compact size. It can easily pick up and carry an adult human on its back.

attacks.name: Endure
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, if this Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's next turn, it is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

data.name: Onix
data.flavorText: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 miles per hour.

attacks.name: Screech
attacks.text: During your next turn, the Defending Pokémon takes 20 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Donphan
data.flavorText: The longer and bigger its tusks, the higher its rank in its herd. The tusks take long to grow.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Larvitar
data.flavorText: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Pupitar
data.flavorText: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.

attacks.name: Dust Devil
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each non-Fighting Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Baltoy
data.flavorText: It moves by spinning on its foot. It is a rare Pokémon that was discovered in ancient ruins.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Medicham
data.flavorText: Through yoga training, it gained the psychic power to predict its foe's next move.

attacks.name: Strike of Enlightenment
attacks.text: If this Pokémon's remaining HP is 30 or less, this attack does 160 more damage.

attacks.name: Spinning Kick
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Meditite
data.flavorText: It eats just one berry a day. By enduring hunger, its spirit is tempered and made sharper.

attacks.name: Bide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, if this Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's next turn, it is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

data.name: Groudon
data.flavorText: This legendary Pokémon is said to represent the land. It went to sleep after dueling Kyogre.

attacks.name: Wreck
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 50 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Ground Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Claydol
data.flavorText: It is said that it originates from clay dolls made by an ancient civilization.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Miraculous Spin
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage for each Steven's Resolve card in your discard pile.

data.name: Regirock
data.flavorText: The same rocks that form its body have been found in ground layers around the world.

attacks.name: Enhanced Stomp
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Hammer Arm
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Palossand-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Eerie Light
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Absorb Life
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sandy Fear-GX
attacks.text: Look at the top 13 cards of your opponent's deck and discard any number of Pokémon you find there. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way. Your opponent shuffles the other cards back into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Minior
data.flavorText: Strong impacts can knock it out of its shell. This Pokémon was born from mutated nanoparticles.

abilities.name: Falling Star
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your hand and your Bench isn't full, you may move your Active Pokémon to your Bench and play this Pokémon as your new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Alolan Rattata
data.flavorText: When the sun goes down, it becomes active. It runs around town on a chase for good food for the boss of its nest—Raticate.

attacks.name: Call for the Boss
attacks.text: Search your deck for Alolan Raticate or Alolan Raticate-GX, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Alolan Raticate-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Chuck Away
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 cards from your hand. This attack does 40 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Item Maniac-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 6 Item cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Sneasel
data.flavorText: It uses its claws to poke holes in eggs so it can slurp out the insides. Breeders consider it a scourge and will drive it away or eradicate it.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Beat Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Pokémon you have in play. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.name: Sableye
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is feared. When its gemstone eyes begin to glow with a sinister shine, it's believed that Sableye will steal people's spirits away.

abilities.name: Excavate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top card of your deck. You may discard that card.

attacks.name: Disable
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Steelix
data.flavorText: It chews its way through boulders with its sturdy jaws. Its eyes can see in the darkness underground.

attacks.name: Tail Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Tyranitar
data.flavorText: If it rampages, it knocks down mountains and buries rivers. Maps must be redrawn afterward.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Trample
attacks.text: For each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's), flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Scizor-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Danger Perception
abilities.text: If this Pokémon's remaining HP is 100 or less, its attacks do 80 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Cross-Cut-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 100 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Mawile
data.flavorText: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.

attacks.name: Mining
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Item card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. If that card is a Pokémon Tool card, instead of putting it into your hand, you may attach it to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

attacks.name: Bite Off
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-GX or a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 30 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Beldum
data.flavorText: With magnetic traction, it pulls its opponents in close. When they're in range, it slashes them with its rear claws.

abilities.name: Conductive Body
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, its Retreat Cost is Colorless less for each Beldum on your Bench.

data.name: Solgaleo
data.flavorText: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.

abilities.name: Full Metal Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Metal Energy attached to it, it has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Rising Dash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Beldum
data.flavorText: With magnetic traction, it pulls its opponents in close. When they're in range, it slashes them with its rear claws.

attacks.name: Single Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Metang
data.flavorText: It adores magnetic minerals, so it pursues Nosepass at speeds exceeding 60 mph.

attacks.name: Bullet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Metagross
data.flavorText: A linkage of two Metang, this Pokémon can perform any calculation in a flash by utilizing parallel processing in its four brains.

abilities.name: Extend
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your turn does not end when you play Steven's Resolve.

attacks.name: Meteor Mash
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Meteor Mash attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Registeel
data.flavorText: Its body is said to be harder than any kind of metal. A study has revealed that its body is hollow.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Silver Fist
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has an Ability, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Jirachi ◇
data.flavorText: It is said to have the ability to grant any wish for just one week every thousand years.
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

abilities.name: Wish Upon a Star
abilities.text: If you took this Pokémon as a face-down Prize card during your turn and your Bench isn't full, before you put it into your hand, you may put it onto your Bench and take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Perish Dream
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep. At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon will be Knocked Out.

data.name: Heatran
data.flavorText: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

attacks.name: Steelworks
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and attach any number of Metal Energy cards you find there to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Steel Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Celesteela
data.flavorText: One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.

attacks.name: Moon Raker
attacks.text: If the total of both players' remaining Prize cards is exactly 6, this attack can be used for Metal.

data.name: Bagon
data.flavorText: With its steel-hard stone head, it headbutts indiscriminately. This is because of the stress it feels at being unable to fly.

attacks.name: Rock Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Kartana
data.flavorText: One of the Ultra Beast life-forms, it was observed cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade.

attacks.name: Divine Paper
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 6 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Stakataka-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ultra Wall
abilities.text: Your Ultra Beasts take 10 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Assembly-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Prize card you have taken. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Bagon
data.flavorText: With its steel-hard stone head, it headbutts indiscriminately. This is because of the stress it feels at being unable to fly.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Shelgon
data.flavorText: They lurk deep within caves—motionless, neither eating nor drinking. Why they don't die is not known.

attacks.name: Raging Blade
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Salamence
data.flavorText: It flies around on its wings, which have grown in at last. In its happiness, it gushes hot flames, burning up the fields it passes over.

abilities.name: Dragon Wind
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

data.name: Latios ◇
data.flavorText: It understands human speech and is highly intelligent. It is a tender Pokémon that dislikes fighting.
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

attacks.name: Dragon Fleet
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your Evolution Dragon Pokémon in play.

data.name: Latias ◇
data.flavorText: It can telepathically communicate with people. It changes its appearance using its down that refracts light.
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

attacks.name: Dreamy Mist
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to each of your Basic Benched Dragon Pokémon.

data.name: Rayquaza-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Stormy Winds
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard the top 3 cards of your deck. If you do, attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Break
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of basic Grass and basic Lightning Energy attached to your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tempest-GX
attacks.text: Discard your hand and draw 10 cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Dunsparce
data.flavorText: It digs into the ground with its tail and makes a mazelike nest. It can fly just a little.

attacks.name: Strike and Run
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck. If you put any Pokémon onto your Bench in this way, you may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sudden Flash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Pelipper
data.flavorText: Gathering food is the work of young males. They store food in their capacious beaks and carry it back to others waiting in the nest.

attacks.name: Firefighting
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Slakoth
data.flavorText: If it eats just three leaves in a day, it is satisfied. Other than that, it sleeps for 20 hours a day.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Slack Off
attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. It can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Wingull
data.flavorText: Fishermen keep an eye out for Wingull in the sky, because wherever they're circling, the ocean is sure to be teeming with fish Pokémon.

data.name: Vigoroth
data.flavorText: Its stress level rises if it cannot keep moving constantly. Too much stress makes it feel sick.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Slaking
data.flavorText: It is the world's most slothful Pokémon. However, it can exert horrifying power by releasing pent-up energy all at once.

abilities.name: Lazy
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon in play have no Abilities, except for Lazy.

attacks.name: Critical Move
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. It can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Whismur
data.flavorText: If it senses danger, it scares the foe by crying out with the volume of a jet-plane engine.

attacks.name: Bawl
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only on your first turn. Your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from their hand during their next turn.

data.name: Whismur
data.flavorText: If it senses danger, it scares the foe by crying out with the volume of a jet-plane engine.

attacks.name: Wail
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Exploud
data.flavorText: Its roar in battle shakes the ground like a tremor—or like an earthquake has struck.

attacks.name: Dangerous Concert
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Loudred
data.flavorText: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.

attacks.name: Cracking Voice
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Delcatty
data.flavorText: It is highly popular among female Trainers for its sublime fur. It does not keep a nest.

abilities.name: Search for Friends
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 2 Supporter cards from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Skitty
data.flavorText: It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail until it gets dizzy.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Kecleon
data.flavorText: It changes its shading to match its surroundings so it can sneak up on prey. Only its belly patterns stay fixed.

abilities.name: Unit Color 2
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon has Unit Energy LightningPsychicMetal attached to it, it is a Lightning, Psychic, and Metal Pokémon.

data.name: Acro Bike
rules: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Discard the other card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Apricorn Maker
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Item cards that have the word "Ball" in their name, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Acro Bike
rules: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Discard the other card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Beast Ball
rules: Look at your face-down Prize cards. You may reveal an Ultra Beast card you find there, put it into your hand, and put this Beast Ball in its place. (If you don't reveal an Ultra Beast card, put this card in the discard pile.) Then, shuffle your face-down Prize cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Copycat
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a card for each card in your opponent's hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Bill's Maintenance
rules: Shuffle a card from your hand into your deck. If you do, draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Hustle Belt
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

If the Pokémon this card is attached to has 30 HP or less remaining and has any damage counters on it, its attacks do 60 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Energy Recycle System
rules:
Choose 1:
• Put a basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.
• Shuffle 3 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card onto the Basic Pokémon to evolve it. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Steven's Resolve
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. Your turn ends.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Fisherman
rules: Put 4 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Hau
rules: Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Hiker
rules: Look at the top 5 cards of either player's deck and choose 1 of them. That player shuffles the other cards back into their deck. Then, put the card you chose on top of that deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: The Masked Royal
rules: Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to one of your Stage 2 Grass, Fire, or Water Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: PokéNav
rules: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon or Energy card you find there and put it into your hand. Put the other cards back in any order.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rainbow Brush
rules: Choose an Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon. Search your deck for a basic Energy card and switch it with that card. Shuffle the first Energy card into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Life Herb
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, heal 60 damage and remove all Special Conditions from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lure Ball
rules: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put an Evolution Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Sky Pillar
rules: Prevent all effects of the opponent's attacks, including damage, done to Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Super Scoop Up
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Tate & Liza
rules:
Choose 1:
• Shuffle your hand into your deck then draw 5 cards.
• Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Underground Expedition
rules: Look at the bottom 4 cards of your deck and put 2 of them into your hand. Put the other cards back on the bottom of your deck in any order.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Friend Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon with the same type as 1 of your opponent's Pokémon in play, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Last Chance Potion
rules: Heal 120 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has 30 HP or less remaining.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lisia
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 ◇ (Prism Star) cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Shrine of Punishment
rules: Between turns, put 1 damage counter on each Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX (both yours and your opponent's).
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: TV Reporter
rules: Draw 3 cards. Then, discard a card from your hand. If you have no cards in your deck, you can't play this card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Tate & Liza
rules:
Choose 1:
• Shuffle your hand into your deck then draw 5 cards.
• Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rainbow Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. While in play, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

data.name: Articuno-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Legendary Ascent
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon. If you do, move any number of Water Energy from your other Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cold Crush-GX
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from both Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Shiftry-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Den of Iniquity-GX
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Your opponent shuffles that Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Blaziken-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Explosive Kick
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blaze Out-GX
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Electrode-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Extra Energy Bomb
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach 5 Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon, except Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, in any way you like. If you do, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Crush and Burn-GX
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Stakataka-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ultra Wall
abilities.text: Your Ultra Beasts take 10 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Assembly-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Prize card you have taken. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Apricorn Maker
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Item cards that have the word "Ball" in their name, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lisia
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 ◇ (Prism Star) cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

rules:
Choose 1:
• Shuffle your hand into your deck then draw 5 cards.
• Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Underground Expedition
rules: Look at the bottom 4 cards of your deck and put 2 of them into your hand. Put the other cards back on the bottom of your deck in any order.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Blaziken-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Explosive Kick
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blaze Out-GX
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Articuno-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Legendary Ascent
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon. If you do, move any number of Water Energy from your other Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cold Crush-GX
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from both Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Banette-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shady Move
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 Pokémon to another Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Chant
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Supporter card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 100 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Tomb Hunt-GX
attacks.text: Put 3 cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Rayquaza-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Stormy Winds
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard the top 3 cards of your deck. If you do, attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Break
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of basic Grass and basic Lightning Energy attached to your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tempest-GX
attacks.text: Discard your hand and draw 10 cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Acro Bike
rules: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Discard the other card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rainbow Brush
rules: Choose an Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon. Search your deck for a basic Energy card and switch it with that card. Shuffle the first Energy card into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Mr. Mime-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Magic Evens
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by your opponent's attacks if that damage is exactly 20, 40, 60, 80, 100, 120, 140, 160, 180, 200, 220, 240, or 260.

attacks.name: Breakdown
attacks.text: For each card in your opponent's hand, put 1 damage counter on their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Life Trick-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Scizor-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Danger Perception
abilities.text: If this Pokémon's remaining HP is 100 or less, its attacks do 80 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Cross-Cut-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 100 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: PokéNav
rules: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon or Energy card you find there and put it into your hand. Put the other cards back in any order.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rainbow Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. While in play, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

data.name: Mr. Mime-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Magic Evens
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by your opponent's attacks if that damage is exactly 20, 40, 60, 80, 100, 120, 140, 160, 180, 200, 220, 240, or 260.

attacks.name: Breakdown
attacks.text: For each card in your opponent's hand, put 1 damage counter on their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Life Trick-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Banette-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shady Move
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 Pokémon to another Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Chant
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Supporter card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 100 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Tomb Hunt-GX
attacks.text: Put 3 cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Scizor-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Danger Perception
abilities.text: If this Pokémon's remaining HP is 100 or less, its attacks do 80 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Cross-Cut-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 100 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Rayquaza-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Stormy Winds
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard the top 3 cards of your deck. If you do, attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Break
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of basic Grass and basic Lightning Energy attached to your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tempest-GX
attacks.text: Discard your hand and draw 10 cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Bill's Maintenance
rules: Shuffle a card from your hand into your deck. If you do, draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Copycat
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a card for each card in your opponent's hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Steven's Resolve
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. Your turn ends.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: TV Reporter
rules: Draw 3 cards. Then, discard a card from your hand. If you have no cards in your deck, you can't play this card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Electrode-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Extra Energy Bomb
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach 5 Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon, except Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, in any way you like. If you do, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Crush and Burn-GX
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Stakataka-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ultra Wall
abilities.text: Your Ultra Beasts take 10 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Assembly-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Prize card you have taken. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Rayquaza-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Stormy Winds
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard the top 3 cards of your deck. If you do, attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Break
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of basic Grass and basic Lightning Energy attached to your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tempest-GX
attacks.text: Discard your hand and draw 10 cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Hustle Belt
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

If the Pokémon this card is attached to has 30 HP or less remaining and has any damage counters on it, its attacks do 60 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Life Herb
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, heal 60 damage and remove all Special Conditions from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Shiftry-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Den of Iniquity-GX
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Your opponent shuffles that Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
